meanings.definition: The office or term of office of a bishop.
meanings.sent1: During his episcopate, the bishop oversaw the construction of a new cathedral.
meanings.sent2: The episcopate of the bishop lasted for ten years.
meanings.sent3: The episcopate of the bishop was so busy, he barely had time to rest.
meanings.sent4: The episcopate of the bishop was like a guiding light for the community.
meanings.sent5: The grandeur of the bishop's episcopate left a lasting impression on the town.

meanings.definition: The order or body of bishops.
meanings.sent1: The episcopate gathered for an important meeting to discuss church matters.
meanings.sent2: The episcopate worked together to address the needs of the parishioners.
meanings.sent3: The episcopate held a friendly competition to see who could memorize the most scripture.
meanings.sent4: The episcopate stood united in their mission to spread kindness and compassion.
meanings.sent5: The strength of the episcopate was evident in their unwavering support for each other.
